title: The 666 Project: A Horror Anthology Show
description:
The 666 Project Returns with 6 Frightening, All New Tales of Horror

In the grand tradition of The Twilight Zone and Tales from the Crypt comes The 666 Project: A Horror Anthology Show. The Push Comedy Theater has gathered six writers, six directors and six actors to bring you six rib-tickling, tales of terror.

Now in its fourth year, The 666 Project has become one of Hampton Roads hottest, Halloween tickets. Don't miss these spine-tingling stories. Six nights... only at the Push Comedy Theater.

 

The Push Comedy Theater is proud to present The 666 Project: A Horror Anthology Show!

October 19, 20, 24, 25, 26 and 27 at 8pm

Tickets are $15 and are available at the link above or at pushcomedytheater.com

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Musical Improv Night
description:
The Musical Improv Night is a monthly show that occurs the first Thursday of every month at Push Comedy Theater at 8 pm.

The show will feature musical improv performing groups that present a variety of completely made up scenes and songs based on audience suggestions.  The show will include short form (Whose Line is it Anyway) musical improv and a Musical Harold (the foundation of long form improv)!

The Musical Improv Night

The 1st Thursday of every month

Show starts at 8PM

Tickets are $5
full_description:
The Musical Improv Night is a monthly show that occurs the first Thursday of every month at Push Comedy Theater at 8 pm.

The show will feature musical improv performing groups that present a variety of completely made up scenes and songs based on audience suggestions. The show will include short form (Whose Line is it Anyway) musical improv and a Musical Harold (the foundation of long form improv)!

The Musical Improv Night

The 1st Thursday of every month

Show starts at 8PM

Tickets are $5

title: Girl-Prov Presents: Gobble Wobble improv Party
description:
GirlProv is an all-female improv show, making audiences lose it with laughter at the Push Comedy Theater.

It's slumber party meets night out on the town meets sorority house party! This month the ladies are feeling GRATEFUL and are celebrating with. Wobble Gobble Party! And good news, YOU’RE INVITED! Grab your gratitude and start thinking about your wildest Thanksgiving memories and meet us for an unforgettable night of comedy all made up on the spot!Girl-Prov: The Girls' Night of ImprovSecond Friday of the month at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 8, tickets are $5Push Comedy Theater763 Granby Street Norfolk, VApushcomedytheater.comThe Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.
full_description:
GirlProv is an all-female improv show, making audiences lose it with laughter at the Push Comedy Theater.


It's slumber party meets night out on the town meets sorority house party!

This month the ladies are feeling GRATEFUL and are celebrating with. Wobble Gobble Party!

And good news, YOU’RE INVITED!

Grab your gratitude and start thinking about your wildest Thanksgiving memories and meet us for an unforgettable night of comedy all made up on the spot!

Girl-Prov: The Girls' Night of Improv
Second Friday of the month at the Push Comedy Theater
The show starts at 8, tickets are $5

Push Comedy Theater
763 Granby Street
Norfolk, VA
pushcomedytheater.com

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.
The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Teacher's Pet
description:
The Students Become The Masters!!!

Teachers and students will join forces for a good old fashioned improv jam!!!

Don't miss it! Some of the Push Comedy's Theater's funniest students share the stage with their teachers, The Pushers. Ordinarily we frown upon fraternization between teachers and students... but for one night only all bets are off!!!

Teachers Pet

Second Friday of the month at 10pm

Tickets are $5



The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

title: Second Saturday Stand-Up
description:
Second Saturday Stand-Up

This once-a-month show is hosted by almost-jaded veteran comic Hatton Jordan who sets the lineup with proven comedians delivering road-tested jokes while they squeeze in new material.

This is NOT a "open mic" .....it's selected talent working on their craft. Every month is a new seasoned lineup.

Every show 90 minutes.

Host: Hatton Jordan

Line up: TBA



Second Saturday Stand-Up

Second Saturday of the month at 10PM

Tickets are $5

title: True Life: The Musical
description:
Each month a guest tells a few stories from their life. Then the improvisers of True Life create a completely improvised musical inspired by the stories. It's a magical night... don't miss it.

True Life: The Musical is a monthly musical improv show that's the second Thursday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater at 8 pm.



True Life: The Musical

The 2nd Thursday of every month.

Show starts at 8PM

Tickets are $5

True Life: The Musical

The 2nd Thursday of every month.

Show starts at 8PM

title: Good Talk: The Brad McMurran Show
description:
Good Talk : I Never Gave Up Hope

The wildly successful one man show by The Push Comedy Theater’s own Brad McMurran is back and more in your face than ever. This show will use McMurran’s favorite Facebook posts from the last year with a comedic focus on his departed best friend. Good Talk: I Never Gave Up Hope will be as unpredictable as the comedian that performs in it.

------

Get ready for a night of comedy from the Pushers' own Brad McMurran.

From the journals and Facebook posts of Brad McMurran, comes Brad's crazy experiences with drugs and alcohol. And there have been many. From peace pipes with Native Americans to waking up in the gutter on Colley Avenue... don't miss this alcohol and drug-filled ride.

Good Talk: The Brad McMurran Show

Fridayy, November 15th at 8pm

Tickets are $15

Good Talk is a one-man show starring Brad McMurran and focusing on McMurran's wildly popular Facebook posts.

Each month, Good Talk looks at the life and experiences of a sketch and improv comedian. Through storytelling, improv and mixed media, Brad will bring his Good Talk Facebook posts to life.

You'll see is struggles with bill collectors, relationships, alcohol, parents, opening a theater and just trying to act like an adult.

The show is going to be an unpredictable, wild and borderline-insane ride... just like Brad's life.

Good Talk : I Never Gave Up Hope

title: ComicKaze presents There Is No Santa Claus (In This Show)
description:
Mid-November is far too early for a Christmas-themed Sketch Comedy show, so ComicKaze Sketch Comedy feat. The Dumpster Dudes assures you that THERE IS NO SANTA CLAUS... in this show. If you come to see this show, you will see hilarious, non-festive comedy scenes, and what won’t you see? Santa Claus, because SANTA DOESN’T EXIST... in this show. Just to be clear, Santa Claus is an absolute fabrication that no fool, no matter how young, should ever believe in... in this show. COMEDY!

ComicKaze presents There Is No Santa Claus (In This Show) feat. The Dumpster Dudes
November 16th | 10PM | $10
------------
ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.
Featuring Kasey Kennedy, Austin Johnson, Alex Weller, Patrick C. Taylor, Trip Rumble, and special guests Yasmeen Freightman & Erika Guess, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon, as well as performing at Philly Sketch Fest and the Virginia Beach Funny Bone.
------------
Dumpster Dudes
The semi-undefeated Sketchmageddon champions, Dumpster Dudes, bring the funny. They’ve discovered that the key to comedy is jokes, and lots of them! They perform sketches that are both funny and on stage. You’ll love how dedicated they are to making humorous quips and witticisms for you, live! You’ll think they made it all up, but they didn’t, it was written. 
Dumpster Dudes. Live on stage sketch comedy.
--------------
The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.
The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.
